description: Dive into "Discover Lyon's Hidden Free Treasures" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Discover Lyon's Hidden Free Treasures

places.generalDescription: The Mur des Canuts, located on the Boulevard des Canuts in Lyon's Croix Rousse district, is a massive mural that showcases the history of the neighborhood, once inhabited by silk weavers known as canuts. Painted in trompe-l'oeil style, it seamlessly integrates with its surroundings. Initially created in 1987, this mural has been periodically updated to reflect changes to nearby structures.

sources.snippet: The Mur des Canuts is one of the largest murals in Europe, located in the Croix-Rousse district. This impressive fresco depicts the daily life of the canuts and has been updated several times to reflect changes in the neighborhood. It's a stunning example of urban art and a tribute to Lyon's silk-weaving heritage.
sources.shortName: 7 Free Things to Do in Lyon
21 Best Things to Do in Lyon: Perfect Lyon Weekend (2025)

sources.snippet: Round off your visit to La Croix-Rousse passing by the Mur des Canuts and visiting Place des Tapis square: here you can see street decorations in the shape of cocoons.
sources.shortName: 10 must-do activities with kids in Lyon!

sources.snippet: The Mur des Canuts took 9 months to finish and is awesome to see firsthand. The scene has a real Lyonnais feel and is brought to life with the optical illusion.
sources.shortName: 21 Completely Free Things to Do in Lyon, France 2024

places.name: Mur des Canuts

reviews.text:
The Mur des Canuts is one of Lyon's most striking and imaginative landmarks-a massive mural that blurs the line between reality and art. Located in the Croix-Rousse district, this incredible trompe-l'≈ìil (trick of the eye) painting spans an entire building fa√ßade and captures the spirit of the neighborhood's history and daily life with astonishing detail.

From a distance, you might mistake it for an actual street scene. Windows, staircases, balconies, people chatting-everything is painted so realistically that it feels like the wall itself is alive. The mural pays tribute to the Canuts, Lyon's 19th-century silk workers, while also evolving over time to reflect the neighborhood's modern character.
Definitely worth the short walk from La Maison des Canute! Amazing the perspective of the mural and it's size

A lovely mural that is extensively detailed. I've heard that the mural is occasionally touched up to age the people in it, which is great attention to detail. We enjoyed checking this out and looking closely at the different parts of it!

places.generalDescription: Parc de la T√™te d'Or is a vast 19th-century park located in Lyon, France. It features statues, fountains, tall trees, a lake, and botanic and rose gardens. The park offers the charming Le Petit du Parc de la Tete d'Or miniature train ride through lush gardens. Visitors can admire stunning flora and fauna while exploring hidden nooks and crannies or simply enjoying the gentle breeze and warm sunshine.

sources.snippet: A little way north of the centre is one of the largest urban parks in the country, with a zoo and France‚Äôs foremost botanical garden within its boundaries. If you‚Äôre around in spring then the international rose garden should be one of your first ports of call in the city. The botanical attractions are spectacular too, with more than 20,000 plant varieties and the most graceful 19th-century greenhouses you could hope to see, thick with the scent of chlorophyll.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Lyon (France)

sources.snippet: Parc de la T√™te d‚ÄôOr ‚Äì This is the largest park in Lyon (some say it‚Äôs the largest park in France!) and a great place to spend a leisurely day. The park covers around 105 hectares, which translated into practical language means that it would take you hours ‚Äì and unlimited energy ‚Äì to explore it all. My recommendation is to pack a picnic, pick a section you like and relax while enjoying the greenery.
sources.shortName: Discovering Lyon with Kids

sources.snippet: Go for a walk and chill out in the Parc de la Tete d‚ÄôOr ‚Äì the 105 hectares green area in the centre of Lyon. Its beautiful and unique each season of the year and you will be coming back to discover it again and again and you will not get bored.Its ideal for a date, family time together and socializing with friends‚Ä¶not to mention, it‚Äôs a great spot for a picnic.
sources.shortName: 25 Free Things To Do In Lyon

sources.snippet: The Berges du Rh√¥ne stretches for 5km along the banks of the Rh√¥ne, linking the Parc de la T√™te d‚Äôor and the Parc de Gerland in a succession of developments varying between natural, mineral and urban styles‚Ä¶ There is a picnic area between L‚ÄôUniversit√© and Galli√©ni bridges.
sources.shortName: 10 must-do activities with kids in Lyon!
14 best things to do in Lyon

sources.snippet: Spend time in the Parc de la Tete d‚ÄôOr ‚Äì so called ‚Äògreen lungs‚Äô of Lyon. It will surprise you with a few things which you may never thought you can do for free. There are indoor and outdoor areas to explore and an impressive collection of flowers.
sources.shortName: Top 10 free things to do in Lyon

sources.snippet: Enjoy the best park ever ‚Äì go to Parc de la Tete d'Or - the 105 hectares green area in the centre of Lyon. Have a walk, picnic, bike ride, meet with friends!. But especially visit the impressive collection of flowers in their Botanic Garden.
sources.shortName: 8 Free Things to Do in Lyon, France

sources.snippet: Set between the leafy Parc de la T√™te d‚ÄôOr and the banks of the River Rhone, you will find the Contemporary Art Institute located across three storeys in the Cite Internationale quarter. We suggest booking tickets online.
sources.shortName: 17 UNIQUE Things to Do in Lyon [in 2025]

sources.snippet: One more thing you should do is to check the biggest park of the city. It's huge and full of possibilities. You can rent a pedal boat and navigate the big lake.
sources.shortName: What to do in Lyon in one, two or three days ?

sources.snippet: There‚Äôs no denying that the streets of Lyon can be, at times, chaotic. So, why not take a break and head to Parc de la T√™te d‚ÄôOr?
sources.shortName: 33 Incredible Things to Do in Lyon in 2025

places.name: Parc de la T√™te d'Or

reviews.text: On a sunny day in Lyon, there's no better escape than the Parc de la T√™te d'Or-a sprawling green paradise that feels like the city's happy soul. Whether you're lounging by the sparkling lake, wandering through rose gardens in full bloom, or watching turtles sunbathe near the botanical gardens, the whole park radiates good vibes. Locals and visitors alike picnic, bike, and bask under the trees, while kids giggle near the carousel and the surprisingly charming zoo. It's the kind of place where time slows down and simple joys-like ice cream in the sun or a quiet stroll-feel totally magical. Pure Lyonnaise bliss!

Big park in the heart of Lyon and close to Central railway. We have free morning time around 1 hour and choose this park walking around.
- Lake and duck is funny and beautiful nature, we love this
- Flower garden is nice but June summer time bit too hot for grew.
- Deer ü¶å in the outside part was cute

Fantastic Park and is absolutely massive.
We didn't realise the scale and size of it until we took the little train tour around it which was over 20 minutes and stopped twice.
There is a large outdoor zoo space boat pedal bikes, botanical Gardens and loads of stop offs for ice cream.
You could genuinely spend all day there and would have a great time. Very fun and close to the bus stops for local bus back to the train station.

places.generalDescription: Parc des Hauteurs is a picturesque hillside park located beneath the basilica of Fourvi√®re in Lyon. Visitors can reach the park by taking a funicular to the top of Fourviere hill, where they will be greeted with stunning panoramic views of Lyon, Saint-Jean-Baptiste Cathedral, the River Saone, and the Presquile peninsula. The park features a rose garden and offers plenty of spots to sit and enjoy the scenery.

sources.snippet: Let this Parc des Hauteurs travel guide be your key to discovering the magic of this park in Lyon. Dive into its history and unique features to discover insights that will make your visit unforgettable. Parc des Hauteurs commands attention in the heart of Lyon, and it‚Äôs no surprise that this irresistible attraction is a highlight of many top-rated tours in Lyon.
sources.shortName: Best Attractions & Places to Visit in Lyon

sources.snippet: Parc des Hauteurs is a municipal park that runs from Loyasse Cemetery to the Montee de l‚ÄôOnge, part of which covers an old tramway. The park itself is the perfect spot for a peaceful walk along the banks of the Saone River ‚Äì simply walk across the Quatre Vents footbridge, along a viaduct, for amazing views of both the Saone and the Croix-Rousse district.
sources.shortName: 17 UNIQUE Things to Do in Lyon [in 2025]

sources.snippet: Parc des Hauters may not seem big but it starts at the bottom of the city and slowly winds all the way up the banks to the top. You can slowly make your way to some incredible lookouts, through rose gardens and water fountains. A must for nature lovers.
sources.shortName: 21 Completely Free Things to Do in Lyon, France 2024

places.name: Parc des Hauteurs

reviews.text: Beautiful park in Lyon. We walked down from the Basilica to the Old Town of Lyon. The views were spectacular and even in late November, there were still leaves on the trees and flowers. It was so peaceful. Beautiful statues along the way. There is a long winding path or you can take much steeper stairs. We took the winding path and the walk was beautiful. Highly recommend visiting this area of Lyon.
I did not even realize i was in a park until i got there by mistake on my way to the cathedral. It is very quiet and has a nice flora ans view over the city. Great place to relax on your climb up.
One of the best Cathederals I have been in, in Europe. You can go outside and look over the city up to the snow capped Alps.

places.generalDescription: The H√¥tel de Ville de Lyon is a beautiful building with impressive architecture from the 17th century. It now serves as the city hall in Lyon. The building is very lively in the evening with all the illumination, and it is a must-go destination if you are in Lyon.

sources.snippet: Just at the edge of the square, the H√¥tel de Ville ‚Äì Lyon‚Äôs City Hall ‚Äì grabs your attention with its stunning 17th-century Baroque facade. It‚Äôs not just a functioning city hall; it‚Äôs a historical treasure. The building‚Äôs lavish design is a testament to the grandeur of Lyon‚Äôs past, with its elegant, classical French architecture.
sources.shortName: üá´üá∑ 21 Best Free Things to Do in Lyon: Big Fun on a Budget!

sources.snippet: The Hotel de Ville (City Hall) in Lyon is one of its most impressive structures in Lyon, and an example of 17th-century architecture. The original building was constructed from 1646 to 1672, but unfortunately, was partially destroyed by fire shortly afterward in 1674.
sources.shortName: 22 Amazing Things To Do In Lyon France

sources.snippet: Rue du Pr√©sident √âdouard Herriot (a shop-lined pedestrian street that leads you to Place des Jacobins and H√¥tel de Ville)

places.name: H√¥tel de Ville de Lyon

reviews.text: A beautiful town hall in Lyon, France. We loved our visit. The architecture is just stunning. It is located in a beautiful square with an amazing fountain and other beautiful buildings. Very historical.

The H√¥tel de Ville de Lyon, or Lyon City Hall, is one of the city's most impressive architectural landmarks-grand, historic, and perfectly situated between Place des Terreaux and the Op√©ra de Lyon. Built in the 17th century and later restored after a fire, this building is a showcase of French Baroque elegance and civic pride.

Its ornate fa√ßade, intricate sculptures, and imposing bell tower make it a standout feature of central Lyon. Every detail, from the symmetrical windows to the sculpted allegories and coats of arms, reflects the building's historic importance and artistic richness. It's especially stunning when illuminated at night, casting a golden glow over the square.
Delightful architecture and so really accessible to the public.  I popped into a small courtyard space by chance to find a ribbed ceiling and what would have been s nice space to chill out!

places.address: 1 Pl. de la Com√©die, 69001 Lyon, France

places.generalDescription: Parc naturel de la Feyssine is a sprawling 55-hectare wooded park located along the Rhone riverside, offering a serene escape from the bustling city. It serves as a green connection between Parc de la Tete d'Or and Grand Parc Miribel-Jonage. The park features jogging and cycling paths, free orienteering courses, and ample space for picnics amidst its organic woodlands and meadows.
places.name: Parc naturel de la Feyssine

reviews.text: Quite place, not so full with visitors.. Great for some yoga, readings, hiking
Good place to go and relaxing.

This park is a bit more wild and less crowded than La Tete d'or nearby. It's a good place if you want to run in nature or walk along the river.
Not enough water fountain though.

places.generalDescription: The Fresque des Lyonnais, also known as the Mural of the Lyonnais, is a magnificent trompe l'oeil painting that graces the exterior of a building in Lyon. This impressive artwork, created by renowned artist Raymond Moretti in 1995, showcases 30 influential and celebrated figures from the city's history.

sources.snippet: I am afraid you will not be able to see it all as Lyon has many amazing mural paintings to discover, but make sure you have seen the most popular!. Find the Fresque des Lyonnais - a mural of famous people from Lyon - which is located at the Quai Saint Vincent, and Le Mur Des Canuts, which is in the Croix Rousse Area.
sources.shortName: 8 Free Things to Do in Lyon, France

sources.snippet: Discover one of the most famous attractions in Lyon with this Fresque des Lyonnais travel guide!. Gain insights about how and when to visit this street art and uncover details that make Fresque des Lyonnais truly unforgettable. Fresque des Lyonnais stands out as a gem among the many tours and activities in Lyon.
sources.shortName: Best Attractions & Places to Visit in Lyon
30 Amazing Things to Do in Lyon (France)

places.name: Fresque des Lyonnais

reviews.text: We did a nice walk along the Sa√¥ne River to this fantastic public art homage to the great personalities of Lyon.
We were walking and we've seen it. It was pretty impressive and make you feel in the old time

This mural of famous Lyonnaise people looking out of windows is captivating.

The world would be a better place if every city showed some pride in its famous sons and daughters and had a mural this.

places.address: 2 Rue de la Martini√®re, 69001 Lyon, France

places.generalDescription: Les Traboules du Vieux Lyon, often referred to as the Secret Passageways of Old Lyon, are a fascinating maze of covered walkways that weave through the city's historic Renaissance district. Dating back to the 4th century, these unique passages were initially designed to offer residents sheltered routes between their homes and the bustling River Sa√¥ne. Over time, they adapted to various needs‚Äîserving as safe havens during turbulent times and facilitating trade in silk when Lyon thrived as a production center.

sources.snippet: In Vieux Lyon and La Croix-Rousse Sa√¥ne are an architectural feature unique to this city: Traboules are delightful renaissance passageways, some 40 of which are open to the public, running beneath buildings in the direction of the Sa√¥ne River. They gave the city‚Äôs silk workers direct access to riverbank, making it quick and easy to transport textiles, while also offering shelter from the elements. Nearly all of these passageways are part of residential properties, so it‚Äôs a good idea to go quietly.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Lyon (France)

sources.snippet: We said that Lyon has a lot of history and, like all good historic places, it‚Äôs got some amazing narrow lanes and secret passages to explore. In fact, in Lyon, there are around 400 of these and they‚Äôre called (as you might have guessed) ‚ÄòTraboules‚Äô. Trying to find these historic, hidden walkways is one of the best, off the beaten track things to do in Lyon.
sources.shortName: 17 UNIQUE Things to Do in Lyon [in 2025]

sources.snippet: Get to know the history of silk production by visiting the Vieux Lyon district. Follow the ‚Äòtraboules‚Äô. These are covered passageways that function as public hallways through the quarters of private houses which were used by silk workers to transport their fabrics.
sources.shortName: Top 10 free things to do in Lyon
14 best things to do in Lyon

places.name: Traboules du Vieux Lyon

reviews.text: So beautiful ! It is not crowded like Paris but has all the charm.. very easy to get around especially for first time tourist‚Ä¶ easily to get around within 15 minutes everywhere.. so many Michilin star restaurant as well as local favorite eatery!!!
Beautiful city and street. Every steps on the street made me heaven.
The traboules of Lyon were my favourite sights of the city. I enjoyed learning about their history from medieval times to the WW2 resistance. They are so unique and useful.

sources.snippet: Les Berges du Rh√¥ne is a series of promenades along the Rh√¥ne river, perfect for walking, cycling, or simply lounging by the water. The banks have been beautifully landscaped and include floating gardens, play areas, and plenty of benches to enjoy the riverside ambiance. Location: Stretching along the Rh√¥ne river in Lyon, France.

sources.snippet: And one of the best places to walk is on a specially constructed group of paths, streets, parks and quais known as the Quais du Rh√¥ne.

reviews.text: A must when in Lyon, weather permitting, is strolling along the Rh√¥ne! You have the best views of the 2nd and can take in all the sites and get some exercise in to enjoy the gastronomic wonders of the city!
